column4: ok, I rebooted to the previous kernel.. will ubuntu always reboot to this kernel in the future or do I have to choose each time from grub
you have to tell grub to boot the older one
no, calm down, extra question marks don't make a difference
who feckin cares about question marks... get a life
I do, I find them annoying, and when I have to erase the answer I was giving you to tell you this, I thought you would care

open a terminal, and type "sudo gedit /boot/grub/menu.lst"  you have three options, you can remove the options for the new kernel from there, or move the kernel you want to use to the top, or change the default to be the older kernel
either help me or clear off :D
I was helping you, you need to calm down
lack of sleep and a bad temper definitely gonna cause me to loose friends fast
if I put # in front of the kernels that I dont want to boot will that be as good as deleting the entries
so If a fix arises in the future for my probs with the .16 kernel it should be simple to get back in to it

I don't think it will be a fix, just a newer kernel would have it, the drivers are part of the kernel, that is why there isn't a roll-back, the newer kernel might have a newer version of the driver that is better for your sound
oh, I see.  Is there a release schedule for kernels or are they just released whenever
I think there is a schedule, but I'm not sure, I don't think that ubuntu releases them right away, I think they test it a bit first
not sure it does them sequentially or altogether
